intro: Pimpinella volkensii, commonly known as the East African cowparsley, is a flowering plant native to regions of East Africa. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant features slender stems and compound leaves with a fern-like appearance. Its small white or yellow flowers are arranged in umbrella-like clusters, typical of the Apiaceae family. Pimpinella volkensii is often found in open woodland and grassland habitats, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
